snippet: Five years into an economic recovery in which corporate profits have surged, the number and quality of jobs are still lagging badly, as are wages and salaries.
abstract: Editorial argues for labor and economic reforms that would boost economy and markedly improve living standards for most American workers; calls on Obama administration and Congress to push a full-employment agenda, along with improvements in wages and working conditions, that regards labor, not corporations, as center of United States economy.
lead_paragraph: Five years into an economic recovery in which corporate profits have surged, the number and quality of jobs are still lagging badly, as are wages and salaries.

headline.seo: Wages and Salaries Still Lag as Corporate Profits Surge
